718381f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir [pump house].
718381f-a.text:

old reservoir.
1890.

718374f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718374f-a.text:
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, eastern part, view north of east,
showing progress of the work of filling the old reservoir and
levelling the eastern retaining wall.
At the extreme right is the Metropolitan Museum of Art, with the
Obelisk, sometimes called ''Cleopatra's Needle', in front of it.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718374f-a.folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY

718376f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718376f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park; Lower Reservoir, view north from the southern
part, showing the work of filling in at an early stage.
March 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a slightly later stage. In both these views the
Upper Reservoir can be glimpsed through the row of trees along
the 86th Street cross-road (Transverse Road No. 2).
June 28, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718376f-b.folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY

718378f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718378f-a.text:
Central Park; old stone house, used as a park building, on the
Morthern side of the former Lower Reservoir.
Before 1935 this building will have been demolished.
March 30, 1931.
.. Sperr.  P. I

718377f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718377f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park, Lower Reservoir (site): A vlew southeast across
the southern side, towards the Carlyle apertment building at
Madison Avenue and 7oth Street. The water has been entirely
drained out.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTTIONS.
(2)
The same, four years later.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718366f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718366f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, western side, view north, showing
the old gate houses and the progress made in filling in the
disused reservoir.
June 28, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, four years later. Notice that the old atone house
on the northern side of the reservoir site has been demolished.
June 24, 1V35.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718366f-a.folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY

718366f-b.folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY

718371f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.
718371f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park : Lower Reservoir, western side, view northwest.
This old reservoir, built around 1840 when the Croton water
system was first constructed, and some time before Central
pari was conceived of, went out of use a year or two prior
to this date. The work of filling it, and demolishing the
2etaining walls, has now begun.
January 6, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view, more to the north; the southwestern
corner of the reservoir is shown at the extreme left of the
picture.
January 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPROOUCTIONS.
(3)
A similar view as No. 2, showing the Reservoir in use. Build-
ings appearing on the left, line the western boundary of the Park,
Central Park West. Note the original appearance of the San Remo,
which appears in the latter views with twin towers.
1927.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
718371f-c.folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
